=Installation=

There are several ways of Installing Grappelli, depending on the location of your media-files and templates): Basically, you just have to replace Djangos /admin/media/ and /admin/templates/-directory.

  # *Download Grappelli Media-Files*
    Go to your admin-media directory and delete all Django Media-Files (including .svn). Then Download the Grappelli Media-Files:
{{{
svn checkout http://django-grappelli.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/media/ .
}}}
  # *Download Grappelli Templates-Files*
    Go to your admin-templates directory and delete all Django Template-Files (including .svn). Then Download the Grappelli Template-Files:
{{{
svn checkout http://django-grappelli.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/templates/ .
}}}

==Using "collapse-open" and "collapse-closed"==

With using Grappelli, you get new classes for displaying fieldsets in the Admin-Interface. With "collapse-open", the headline of the fieldset is collapsible and open by default. With "collapse-closed", the headline of the fieldset is collapsible but closed by default. Without using a class, the fieldset wonÂ´t be collapsible.
{{{
class EntryOptions(admin.ModelAdmin):
    ....
    fieldsets = (
        ('', {
            'fields': ('title', 'subtitle', 'slug', 'pub_date', 'status',),
        }),
        ('Flags', {
            'classes': ('collapse-closed',),
            'fields' : ('flag_front', 'flag_sticky', 'flag_allow_comments', 'flag_comments_closed',),
        }),
        ('Tags', {
            'classes': ('collapse-closed',),
            'fields' : ('tags',),
        }),
        ('Image', {
            'fields' : ('image',),
        }),
        ('Content', {
            'classes': ('collapse-open',),
            'fields' : ('summary', 'body',),
        }),
        ('Author', {
            'classes': ('collapse-closed',),
            'fields' : ('author',),
        }),
    )
    class Media:
        ....
}}}

==Using TinyMCE==

  # *Change the media-definition of your !ModelAdmin*
{{{
    class Media:
        js = ['/media/admin/tinymce_2/jscripts/tiny_mce/tiny_mce.js', '/media/admin/tinymce_setup/tinymce_setup.js',]
}}}
  # *Optional: Change paths in tinymce_setup.js*
    Open tinymce_setup.js and change the following paths according to your media-setup.
{{{
    content_css: "/media/admin/tinymce_setup/css_grappelli/content.css",
    editor_css: "/media/admin/tinymce_setup/css_grappelli/editor.css",
    popup_css: "/media/admin/tinymce_setup/css_grappelli/popup.css",
}}} 
  # *Optional: Change tinymce_setup.js*
    Open tinymce_setup.js and adjust the setup/behaviour of TinyMCE according to your needs - see http://wiki.moxiecode.com/index.php/TinyMCE:Configuration
